headline.main: THE POLITICAL CRISIS.; Kentucky and the Dissolution of the Union. Interesting Letter from Rev. Dr. Breckinridge to Vice-President Breckinridge.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Hon. John C. Breckinridge, Vice-President of the United States, and Senator elect front the Commonwealth of Kentucky. For a period of nearly seventy years, the people of Kentucky, even from the moment of their own existence as a free and separate Commonwealth, have bestowed, first upon your grandfather, and then upon your father, and then upon yourself, every mark of confidence and love it was...

docs.snippet: It is always doubtful whether it be not a waste of time to discuss the merits of the "bills" which find their way into the NewYork Legislature, as, fortunately for the State, the proportion of those brought in which eventually receive the Governor's...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is always doubtful whether it be not a waste of time to discuss the merits of the "bills" which find their way into the NewYork Legislature, as, fortunately for the State, the proportion of those brought in which eventually receive the Governor's signature is almost always very comfortably small.

docs.snippet: The Board of Aldermen, last evening, received a petition from the Nursery and Child's Hospital, asking for $1,000, to aid in paying for the building of the institution, which cost $3,500. It was referred to the Committee on Finance.

headline.main: CITY GOVERNMENT.; BOARD OF ALDERMEN. GIDEON J. TUCKER FOR CROTON AQUEDUCT COMMISSIONER--SPRINKLING SALT--WEST WASHINGTON MARKET--THE STRICTURES OF THE HERALD--THE HISTORY OF BENNETT.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Jan. 17, 1860. This morning the attendance in the House was  unusually thin, and, after prayers, several devices, such as roll-call and so forth, were adopted to give time for a collection of the absentees. After the first...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Jan. 17, 1860. This morning the attendance in the House was unusually thin, and, after prayers, several devices, such as roll-call and so forth, were adopted to give time for a collection of the absentees. After the first roll-call most of the Republicans were in their seats, but the Democratic benches were very sparsely occupied.

headline.main: United States Circuit Court.; BEFORE JUDGE BETTS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States vs McAnoy.--The question which arose in this case and others, whether the indictment was valid, being found at a time when there was no United States District-Attorney, came up this morning. headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; Gen. Bowman Elected Printer to the Senate. The Plurality Rule Debated in the House. SPEECH OF MR. HUTCHINS, OF OHIO. Mr. Hickman, of Pennsylvania, on the Defensive.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Jan. 17. Brigadier BOWMAN was elected Printer to the Senate to-day, but not until he was raked fore and aft by Senator BROWN, who denounced him as a deliberate violator of law, and either grossly stupid or grossly corrupt. The Senator also made allusion to the forced contribution for the Pennsylvanian and ...

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Jan. 17. There being a slim attendance, there was a call of the House.  Mr. PENNINGTON withdrew his resolution proposing the adoption of the plurality rule. He did so, he said, to avoid confusion.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Jan. 17. There being a slim attendance, there was a call of the House. Mr. PENNINGTON withdrew his resolution proposing the adoption of the plurality rule. He did so, he said, to avoid confusion.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN MARYLAND.; Affairs at the State Capital--New Police-- Future Elections--Astounding Election Frauds--United States Senator--Future Politics of Maryland--Senator Douglas-- Maryland Finances--A View of Southern Trade with Baltimore--Wedding--Weather--Harbor,&c.

docs.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE, Wednesday, Jan. 11, 1860. Our State Legislature is now in session at An napolis. Its proceedings are, and will be, looked to with deep interest. Measures of decided moment having especial reference to Baltimore, have already been introduced. Amongst these is a Metropolitan Police bill, to regulate the Police Department of our city. This, to us, is a matter of vital importance.

docs.snippet: The arrival of the Europa at Halifax, and of the Jura at New-York, continue our European intelligence to the last day of the last year. Little of interest had transpired in addition to the advices of the Hungarian, save the sudden death of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The arrival of the Europa at Halifax, and of the Jura at New-York, continue our European intelligence to the last day of the last year. Little of interest had transpired in addition to the advices of the Hungarian, save the sudden death of the greatest of British historical writers, Lord MACAULAY, an event which occurred in London on the 28th ult.
